full_text:
Updated prior to Week 14: Relative team efficiency scores, constructed using a blend of z-score standardized EPA/P and SR%

Data is from weeks 4-13. Early downs, opponent adjusted, turnovers are excluded, garbage time is excluded

#nflverse https://t.co/BoSQd2BHmz

Snap Counts. Added a new chart for each position. One is the snap percentages chart, the other is the snap count. Personally, I think the snap % tells the more accurate story, but both give context. 

TE's. Very clear 1, 2, 3 here, with Kelce leading.

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/FI14Y9Kyt7

Wide Receivers next. I have no idea why Justin Watson got the second most snaps out of all the wide receivers this week. Ask the @KCSportsNetwork Lab guys. JuJu's snap % went way up after being on a snap count post-concussion. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/rrnJxBuqG6

On to Running Backs!! McKinnon and Pacheco have been doing a little back and forth dance for that #1 RB spot since week 10 vs the Jags. Almost perfectly in balance this week. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/CcQ6Th5Ujn

Play-action rate for QBs with min 100 attempts

Bottom number labels represent # of PA attempts
Darkness of bar represents yards per PA attempt

Daniel Jones
PA Rate: 23.9% (4th)
7.2 yards per PA attempt (27th)

#TogetherBlue #nflverse https://t.co/AIKF0Qy3iD
